description: General feats are available when you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class or when specified by other features.

feats.name: Ability Score Improvement
feats.description: Increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feat.

feats.name: Actor
feats.description: You have honed your ability to mimic others and craft convincing disguises.

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Impersonation
benefits.description: While you're disguised as a real or fictional person, you have Advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks to convince others that you are that person.

benefits.name: Mimicry
benefits.description: You can mimic the sounds of other creatures, including speech. To mimic a sound or voice, you must have heard it for at least 1 minute. A successful Wisdom (Insight) check against your Charisma (Deception) check allows a listener to determine that the effect is faked.

feats.name: Athlete
feats.description: Your extensive physical training grants you the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Climb Speed
benefits.description: You gain a Climb Speed equal to your Speed.

benefits.name: Hop Up
benefits.description: When you have the Prone condition, you can right yourself as a Bonus Action.

benefits.name: Jumping
benefits.description: You can make a running Long or High Jump after moving only 5 feet.

feats.name: Charger
feats.description: You have trained to charge headlong into battle.

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Improved Dash
benefits.description: When you take the Dash action, your Speed increases by 10 feet for that action.

benefits.name: Charge Attack
benefits.description: If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line toward a target immediately before hitting it with a melee attack using a weapon, you can use a Bonus Action to make an extra attack against the target with the same weapon. You can use this Bonus Action only once per turn.

feats.name: Chef
feats.description: Your skill in the kitchen grants you the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Constitution or Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Cook's Utensils Proficiency
benefits.description: You gain proficiency with Cook's Utensils if you don't already have it.

benefits.name: Replenishing Meal
benefits.description: As part of a Short Rest, you can cook special food if you have Cook's Utensils and ingredients on hand. The food grants temporary hit points equal to 1d8 plus your proficiency bonus to each creature that eats it.

benefits.name: Bolstering Treats
benefits.description: With 1 hour of work or when you finish a Long Rest, you can cook a number of treats equal to your proficiency bonus. These treats last 8 hours. A creature can eat a treat as a Bonus Action to gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

feats.name: Crossbow Expert
feats.description: Thanks to extensive practice with crossbows, you gain the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Ignore Loading
benefits.description: You ignore the Loading property of crossbows.

benefits.name: Firing in Melee
benefits.description: Being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose Disadvantage on your attack rolls with crossbows.

benefits.name: Dual Wielding
benefits.description: When you make the extra attack of the Light property with a Light weapon, you can make that extra attack with a hand crossbow you are holding.

feats.name: Crusher
feats.description: You have mastered dealing bludgeoning damage, gaining the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Strength or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Push
benefits.description: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals Bludgeoning damage, you can move it 5 feet to an unoccupied space if the target is no more than one size larger than you.

benefits.name: Enhanced Critical
benefits.description: When you score a Critical Hit that deals Bludgeoning damage to a creature, attack rolls against that creature have Advantage until the start of your next turn.

feats.name: Defensive Duelist
feats.description: You excel at defending yourself while engaged in combat, gaining the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Parry
benefits.description: If you're holding a Finesse weapon and a creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your Reaction to add your proficiency bonus to your AC for that attack, potentially causing it to miss.

feats.name: Dual Wielder
feats.description: You've mastered fighting with a weapon in each hand, gaining the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Enhanced Dual Wielding
benefits.description: When you take the Attack action on your turn and attack with a weapon that has the Light property, you can make one extra attack as a Bonus Action later on the same turn with a different weapon. That weapon doesn't need to have the Light property, but you can't use Two-Handed weapons with this extra attack.

benefits.name: Quick Draw
benefits.description: You can draw or stow two weapons that lack the Two-Handed property when you would normally be able to draw or stow only one.

feats.name: Durable
feats.description: Hardy and resilient, you gain the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Defy Death
benefits.description: You have Advantage on Death Saving Throws.

benefits.name: Speedy Recovery
benefits.description: As a Bonus Action, you can expend one of your Hit Point Dice, roll it, and regain a number of Hit Points equal to the roll.

feats.name: Elemental Adept
feats.repeatable_note: Choose a different damage type each time
feats.description: You have attained elemental mastery over one of the following damage types: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder.

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Energy Mastery
benefits.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to damage of the chosen type. In addition, when you roll damage for a spell you cast that deals damage of that type, you can treat any 1 on a damage die as a 2.

feats.name: Fey Touched
feats.description: Your exposure to the Feywild or one of its denizens has left a magical mark on you.

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Fey Magic
benefits.description: You learn the Misty Step spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the Divination or Enchantment school of magic. You can cast each of these spells once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast them in this way when you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast them using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

feats.name: Fighting Initiate
feats.repeatable_note: Choose a different Fighting Style each time
feats.description: You have learned a Fighting Style. Choose one of the Fighting Style options from the Fighter class.

benefits.name: Fighting Style
benefits.description: You learn a Fighting Style of your choice from the Fighter class. Whenever you gain a level, you can replace this feat's Fighting Style with another from the Fighter class.

feats.name: Grappler
feats.description: You're an accomplished wrestler, granting you the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Punch and Grab
benefits.description: When you hit a creature with an Unarmed Strike as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a Bonus Action to try to grapple that creature.

benefits.name: Attack Advantage
benefits.description: You have Advantage on attack rolls against a creature you are grappling.

feats.name: Great Weapon Master
feats.description: You've learned to use the weight of a weapon to your advantage, gaining the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Heavy Weapon Mastery
benefits.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon that has the Heavy property as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can cause the weapon to deal extra damage to the target equal to your proficiency bonus.

benefits.name: Hew
benefits.description: Immediately after you score a Critical Hit with a Melee weapon or reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points with one, you can make one attack with the same weapon as a Bonus Action.

feats.name: Heavily Armored
feats.description: You have trained to use Heavy Armor effectively, gaining the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Constitution or Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Armor Training
benefits.description: You gain proficiency with Heavy Armor.

feats.name: Heavy Armor Master
feats.description: You can use your Heavy Armor to deflect strikes, gaining the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Constitution or Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Damage Reduction
benefits.description: When you're hit by an attack while wearing Heavy Armor, any Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage dealt to you by that attack is reduced by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.

feats.name: Inspiring Leader
feats.description: You can inspire your companions, giving them heart to face any danger:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Wisdom or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Encouraging Performance
benefits.description: At the end of a Short or Long Rest, you can give an inspiring speech or performance. When you do so, choose up to six friendly creatures (which can include yourself) within 30 feet who can see or hear you and who can understand you. Each of those creatures gains Temporary Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your proficiency bonus plus your Wisdom or Charisma modifier.

feats.name: Keen Mind
feats.description: You have a mind that can track time, direction, and detail with uncanny precision:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Lore Knowledge
benefits.description: You gain proficiency in your choice of Arcana, History, Investigation, Nature, or Religion. If you already have proficiency in the chosen skill, you gain Expertise in it.

benefits.name: Quick Study
benefits.description: You can take the Study action as a Bonus Action.

feats.name: Lightly Armored
feats.description: You have trained to use Light Armor effectively, gaining the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Armor Training
benefits.description: You gain proficiency with Light Armor and Shields.

feats.name: Mage Slayer
feats.description: You have practiced techniques useful in melee combat against spellcasters:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Concentration Breaker
benefits.description: When you damage a creature that is concentrating, it has Disadvantage on the saving throw it makes to maintain Concentration.

benefits.name: Guarded Mind
benefits.description: If you fail a saving throw against a spell that would give you the Charmed or Frightened condition, you can use your Reaction to reroll the save, and you must use the new roll.

feats.name: Martial Weapon Training
feats.description: You have trained with military weapons, gaining the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Weapon Proficiency
benefits.description: You gain proficiency with Martial weapons.

feats.name: Medium Armor Master
feats.description: You have practiced moving in medium armor, gaining the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Dexterous Wearer
benefits.description: While you're wearing Medium Armor, you can add 3, rather than 2, to your AC if you have a Dexterity of 16 or higher.

feats.name: Moderately Armored
feats.description: You have trained to use Medium Armor and Shields effectively, gaining the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Armor Training
benefits.description: You gain proficiency with Medium Armor and Shields.

feats.name: Mounted Combatant
feats.description: You have developed a bond with your mounts, gaining the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Strength, Dexterity, or Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Mount Handler
benefits.description: You have Advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks made to handle or train horses and similar creatures.

benefits.name: Mounted Strike
benefits.description: While mounted, you have Advantage on attack rolls against any unmounted creature within 5 feet of your mount that is smaller than it.

benefits.name: Leap Aside
benefits.description: If your mount is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails. For your mount to gain this benefit, you must be riding it, and neither of you can have the Incapacitated condition.

benefits.name: Veer
benefits.description: While mounted, you can use your Reaction to cause an attack that hits your mount to hit you instead.

feats.name: Observant
feats.description: Quick to notice details, you gain the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Intelligence or Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Keen Observer
benefits.description: Choose one of the following skills: Insight, Investigation, or Perception. If you lack proficiency with the chosen skill, you gain proficiency in it, and if you have proficiency with it, you gain Expertise in it.

benefits.name: Quick Search
benefits.description: You can take the Search action as a Bonus Action.

feats.name: Piercer
feats.description: You have achieved a degree of mastery in puncturing attacks, gaining the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Puncture
benefits.description: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals Piercing damage, you can reroll one of the attack's damage dice, and you must use the new roll.

benefits.name: Enhanced Critical
benefits.description: When you score a Critical Hit that deals Piercing damage to a creature, you can roll one additional damage die when determining the extra Piercing damage the target takes.

feats.name: Poisoner
feats.description: You have mastered the creation and use of poisons, gaining the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Dexterity or Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Potent Poison
benefits.description: When you make a damage roll that deals Poison damage, it ignores Resistance to Poison damage.

benefits.name: Poison Savant
benefits.description: You gain proficiency with the Poisoner's Kit if you don't already have it. With one hour of work using a Poisoner's Kit and expending 50 GP worth of materials, you can create a number of poison doses equal to your proficiency bonus. Once applied to a weapon or piece of ammunition, the poison retains its potency for 1 minute or until you hit with the weapon. When a creature takes damage from the coated weapon, that creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus your proficiency bonus plus your Intelligence modifier) or take 2d8 Poison damage and have the Poisoned condition until the end of your next turn.

feats.name: Polearm Master
feats.description: You have learned to use the length of your polearm to maximum effect, gaining the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Pole Strike
benefits.description: Immediately after you take the Attack action and attack with a Quarterstaff, Spear, or weapon that has the Heavy and Reach properties, you can use a Bonus Action to make a melee attack with the opposite end of the weapon. The damage die for this attack is a d4, and it deals Bludgeoning damage.

benefits.name: Reactive Strike
benefits.description: While you're holding a Quarterstaff, Spear, or weapon that has the Heavy and Reach properties, you can use your Reaction to make one melee attack against a creature that enters the reach you have with that weapon.

feats.name: Resilient
feats.repeatable_note: Choose a different ability score each time
feats.description: Choose one ability in which you lack saving throw proficiency. You gain the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase the chosen ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Saving Throw Proficiency
benefits.description: You gain saving throw proficiency with the chosen ability.

feats.name: Ritual Caster
feats.description: You have learned a number of spells that you can cast as rituals.

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Ritual Spells
benefits.description: You have acquired a ritual book holding two 1st-level spells of your choice. The spells must have the Ritual tag from the spell list corresponding to your spellcasting ability. When you find a spell with the Ritual tag from the same spell list, you can transcribe it into your ritual book.

benefits.name: Casting Rituals
benefits.description: You can cast any spell in your ritual book as a Ritual.

feats.name: Sentinel
feats.description: You have mastered techniques to take advantage of every drop in any enemy's guard:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Guardian
benefits.description: Immediately after a creature within 5 feet of you takes the Disengage action or hits a target other than you with an attack, you can make an Opportunity Attack against that creature.

benefits.name: Halt
benefits.description: When you hit a creature with an Opportunity Attack, the creature's Speed becomes 0 for the rest of the current turn.

feats.name: Shadow Touched
feats.description: Your exposure to the Shadowfell's magic or a creature from that plane has left a magical mark on you.

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Shadow Magic
benefits.description: You learn the Invisibility spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the Illusion or Necromancy school of magic. You can cast each of these spells once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast them in this way when you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast them using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

feats.name: Sharpshooter
feats.description: You can make shots that others find impossible, gaining the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Bypass Cover
benefits.description: Your ranged attacks with weapons ignore Half Cover and Three-Quarters Cover.

benefits.name: Firing in Melee
benefits.description: Being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose Disadvantage on your attack rolls with ranged weapons.

benefits.name: Long Shots
benefits.description: Attacking at long range doesn't impose Disadvantage on your attack rolls with ranged weapons.

feats.name: Shield Master
feats.description: You've trained to use shields not just for protection but also for offense:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Shield Bash
benefits.description: If you attack a creature within 5 feet of you as part of the Attack action and hit with a Melee weapon, you can immediately use a Bonus Action to try to shove that creature with your shield.

benefits.name: Interpose Shield
benefits.description: If you're subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can use your Reaction to take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, interposing your shield between yourself and the source of the effect.

feats.name: Skill Expert
feats.description: You have honed your proficiency with particular skills, gaining the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Skill Proficiency
benefits.description: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

benefits.name: Expertise
benefits.description: Choose one skill in which you have proficiency. You gain Expertise in that skill.

feats.name: Skulker
feats.description: You excel at skulking in shadows and staying hidden:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Blindsight
benefits.description: You have Blindsight with a range of 10 feet.

benefits.name: Fog of War
benefits.description: You exploit the distractions of battle, gaining Advantage on any Dexterity (Stealth) check you make as part of the Hide action during combat.

benefits.name: Sniper
benefits.description: If you make an attack roll while hidden and the roll misses, making the attack roll doesn't end the Hidden condition on you.

feats.name: Slasher
feats.description: You have mastered dealing slashing damage, gaining the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Hamstring
benefits.description: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals Slashing damage, you can reduce the Speed of the target by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

benefits.name: Enhanced Critical
benefits.description: When you score a Critical Hit that deals Slashing damage to a creature, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

feats.name: Speedy
feats.description: You are exceptionally speedy, gaining the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Dexterity or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Speed Increase
benefits.description: Your Speed increases by 10 feet.

benefits.name: Dash Over Difficult Terrain
benefits.description: When you take the Dash action on your turn, Difficult Terrain doesn't cost you extra movement for the rest of that turn.

benefits.name: Agile Movement
benefits.description: Opportunity Attacks have Disadvantage against you.

feats.name: Spell Sniper
feats.description: You have trained your magical abilities for targeting at long range:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Bypass Cover
benefits.description: Your attack rolls for spells ignore Half Cover and Three-Quarters Cover.

benefits.name: Casting in Melee
benefits.description: Being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose Disadvantage on your attack rolls with spells.

benefits.name: Increased Range
benefits.description: When you cast a spell that has a range of at least 10 feet and requires you to make an attack roll, you can increase the spell's range by 60 feet.

feats.name: Telekinetic
feats.description: Your mental discipline grants you the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Minor Telekinesis
benefits.description: You learn the Mage Hand cantrip. You can cast it without Verbal or Somatic components, you can make the spectral hand invisible, and if you already know this cantrip, its range increases by 30 feet when you cast it. The cantrip's spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

benefits.name: Telekinetic Shove
benefits.description: As a Bonus Action, you can try to telekinetically shove one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. When you do so, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 8 plus your proficiency bonus plus your spellcasting ability modifier) or be moved 5 feet toward you or away from you.

feats.name: Telepathic
feats.description: Your mind awakens to telepathic power, granting you the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Telepathy
benefits.description: You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Your telepathic utterances are in a language you know, and the creature understands you only if it knows that language. Your communication doesn't give the creature the ability to respond to you telepathically.

benefits.name: Detect Thoughts
benefits.description: You can cast the Detect Thoughts spell, requiring no spell slot. Once you cast this spell with this feat, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

feats.name: War Caster
feats.description: You have practiced casting spells in the midst of combat, gaining the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Concentration
benefits.description: You have Advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain Concentration.

benefits.name: Reactive Spell
benefits.description: When a creature provokes an Opportunity Attack from you by leaving your reach, you can take a Reaction to cast a spell at the creature rather than making an Opportunity Attack. The spell must have a casting time of one action and must target only that creature.

benefits.name: Somatic Components
benefits.description: You can perform the Somatic components of spells even when you have weapons or a Shield in one or both hands.

feats.name: Weapon Master
feats.description: You have practiced extensively with a variety of weapons, gaining the following benefits:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

benefits.name: Mastery Property
benefits.description: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery property of one kind of Simple or Martial weapon of your choice. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can change the weapon you chose to another eligible weapon.
